text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, Mangtastic, Feste, fosters, Gumfish, atticusonline, Setzkin, TheSoulBear, Doc_Rostov)

name: twntysevn27
text: Way to stick up for the Aspies. Chubby for you.

name: dukieshane
text: A comment left by dukieshane was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TheLoneliestMonkey, thedudeabides85, J-Man)

name: bobodante
text: I gotta fully agree on your comments. This one really strikes a chord with me, and I love the transition from plotline wrap up into a wholly new, but no less, interesting new arc. Well done, Mr. Onstad.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Agreed. I've added "this world ain't nothing but bad news and the pills that go with it" to my e-mail signature.

name: snowman
text:
Yep, yep, and yep. I found this one hilarious and moving as well. Cornily, I even found parallels between this and my own life. I think it actually probably did its part in convincing me to marry my girl. This is really Achewood at its best.

"Clopsy" is maybe the best thing ever and I am definitely going to start using it. "Man I got hell of clopsy last night at the Bikini..."

name: rogergs
text:
Yeah, the worst was waiting in what you thought was a bread line and it turned out to be for one of those guys selling apples for a nickel.

And you didn't have a nickel.

name: dukieshane
text: When I said "invoking," I meant "evoking." Shit. Onstad is gonna think I'm a real rube.

name: hannah
text: you've done well to use 'rube,' though, i think you'll get mad props for that.

name: jackparsons
text: Hey rube!

name: semiquaver
text:
Don't make it bad.
Take a hay bale, and make it better.

name: wittyname
text: Your description made this go from a 4 to a 5.

name: ajesteronly
text:
"Could be, doesn't have to be. A dude walks down the street and a plane lands on his head; he never did what mattered. Just sayin'."

"still though man slippery slope to a cradle a mortgage and a grave"

"You even think for a minute there's some better way to play it?"

Absolute true poetry. It was this last panel that made me get married. I mean, Ray is so right. It's an imperfect game, but there's no more beautiful game in the world.

name: girlandagun
text: I have plans to cross-stitch Ray's words of wisdom on a pillow. It will make a good wedding present a couple I know who are planning on trading mini-quiches for gifts in the near future. They were probably expecting me to get them an electric blender so that when I visit they can mix me drinks on the deck.

name: projectyl
text: A comment left by projectyl was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, mortshire, Judy)

name: sargasm
text: A comment left by sargasm was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, pwb, mortshire)

name: lexsenthur
text:
Remembering stuff is hard , dude!

What did you say at this time yesterday? See!

name: petronius
text: roast beef is a genius, and i am in love with him.

name: rogergs
text: That would be Randy, he of the buck teeth and burled coif?

name: lateadopter
text: I was half-thinking Envelope would have been able to go back to his original look after Ray and Beef razed the Acres.  No shame in having lost a fight to a dude who became the ruling body.

name: straw
text:
Let's compare and contrast:

[IMGS OFF]

It might be that it's nearly a year and a half later, and judging by the fact he's able to afford living in Ray's neighborhood his "plastic surgeon" who "reattached his face" was "probably" "good." Who knows where he got his chica eyebrows and bathroom dye job? Maybe he thinks that's sufficient evidence, since Ray won the Fight, for all of his peers to believe Ray's story.

name: i_love_kate
text: I enjoy that the tattoo letter on his arm is different, but his beard is the same colour.

name: aikennubbles
text: If Roast Beef marries Molly I'm totally going to be one of those soap opera-watching housewives all wearing my own veil and crying, like "Love is so beautiful."

name: sherief
text: I don't even care if he marries her.  This arc could end, and I'm already crying.  I'm glad I read the alt-text early on because otherwise I'd be having to think about "chica eyebrows and a bathroom dye job" through stifled tears and hells of emotions.  That's some dialectical shit.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Well, heck fire Bubba, I'd run for a free hot cheese sandwich too.

name: catachresis
text: Beef sasses Ray about wedding snacks, again.

name: neitherman
text: God dammit Beef... I can't help but agree with you.

name: jackparsons
text: We did my wedding put luck. It's the only way to fly.

name: semiquaver
text: Putt luck.  Wherein you only get to eat if you sink 6/10, and you can't sit if you're under 3.

name: twohundredninety
text: This strip is so amazingly good I think I'm going to have to go back through my rated strips and change some fives to fours. Because this is so much better than those.

name: semiquaver
text: Dude, that is highly vexing of you.  There is no reason to rate any Achewood strip less than 5.  Just don't rate ones you like less anything at all.  Be a Molly in a world that ain't nothing but bad news and the pills that go with it.

name: deusoma
text: Certain people would disagree with you, and bring up the cumbrella strip as evidence. I am not one of those people, because the cumbrella strip gave me a hearty, if shallow, laugh.

name: tekende
text: I'm not sure anything can be hearty and shallow at the same time.

name: deusoma
text: Hearty in volume, shallow in motivation.

name: tekende
text: Fair enough.

name: nutmeg
text:
guest starring in his own life.

beautiful.

name: fineoakstructure
text: reminiscent of Pavement in Shady Lane: "an extra in the movie adaptation of the sequel to your life"

name: aeon
text: Velly nice, I especially liked Ray's comment on the world being nothing but bad news and the pills that go with it.

name: apatfan
text: What he's talking about is basically a thing!

name: magnumt
text: Is sharing the same opinion on marriage with a cartoon cat a good thing?

name: andrew_
text: only if that cat is Roast Beef

name: donjolly
text: Does this mark a change in direction for the storyline? Looks like, even though the lawn ornament wars were cool  too. But a Beef / Molly marriage would basically rock.

name: m3funkyb
text: ray is half brain dead from too much binge drinking

name: roastbeet
text: Attention hackers: if you know how to hack the site so I can give this strip a 6, message me.

name: zefiel
text: I'd give this strip a 6 if science let me.

name: featurelessvoid
text: Science, always getting in the way!  I tell you, what we need less of is science.

name: nihraguk
text: "A dude walks down a street and a plane lands on his head; he never did what mattered." Brilliant!

name: kazad
text: Yeah, Ray's really good at that "here's a vivid flash of the worst possible thing that can happen if you carry on with your current actions" thing, like when he was just laying into Pat for talkign to him while he was driving.

name: jeannetteandre
text: Living in Florida and having cable television I can say for certain that Envelope has to be heavily based on Hulk Hogan.

name: nigelchaos
text: Wow. Now that you mention it. He does look like The Tan That Walks Like A Man.

name: trollcollins
text: Roast Beef has such a quirky, off-beat, unexpected sort of genius. It's very endearing. I'd never think of a false advertising an ultra-patriotic free cheese sandwich as a means of ridding myself of pesky Christian fundamentalists and such, but he comes up with it just as easy as breathing.

name: trollcollins
text: Obviously I also would never think of proof-reading a comment before posting it.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by twntysevn27, fosters, Moraiat, equinn2006, Sargasm)

name: czarcastic
text: "clopsy"

name: padijun
text: I hope the Last Honest Cheese Sandwich is in the next Achewood cookbook

name: czarcastic
text: sounds like a country ballad

name: tekende
text:
Stopped in a diner
On my way from San Anton'
Waitress her name was Dinah
I looked at her and begged
I ain't got no money
I ain't got no woman
Have mercy on a poor man, honey

It was there she gave me
the Last Honest Cheese Sandwich

name: shmuckeles
text: it's a whole new level

name: supergeorgina
text: LOVE IS REMEMBERING THINGS THEY SAY

name: tekende
text: Love means never having to say "I forgot"

name: featurelessvoid
text: A comment left by featurelessvoid was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, Zefiel, silver_lake, Mangtastic, astro_zombie, wargasmic, mortshire, bug, equinn2006, Sargasm, nutmeg, MrCreighton, MrPoopytime, benfromtenn, Mastronaut, Crimson_King)

name: zefiel
text: OUT OF CHARACTER. Oh man don't go saying I jump over shark tanks that is hell of asinine

name: featurelessvoid
text: A comment left by featurelessvoid was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by silver_lake, Mangtastic, fosters, bug, equinn2006, prius_chaser, Sargasm, bixschmix, MrPoopytime, cbtbone, stormagnet, Mastronaut)

name: zefiel
text: Hey, thanks for replying with some actual reasoning. That's dope. Anyway, I believe this strip is still within the standards of what we can expect of Achewood, since the comic has always shown a strong character development curve, and it has remained consistent with it. No one complained when Beef and Molly paired up, even if it was breaking the character stereotype of 'eternally depressed and socially incompetent'. A big part of what we appreciate in Onstad's work is how he managed to create endearing characters we can relate to, and then set them off to be free and grow.

name: featurelessvoid
text: Okay, okay. Am I at least allowed to say that this strip jumped the mountain ?

name: wehavemagnums
text: Things like this happen precisely because Achewood charcters are not one-dimensional and static. Ray's not a complete buffoon. He cares about his friend. Dammit, I care!

name: differentdog
text: did you think you were reading garfield or something? isn't there something else excellent you can ruin, like a birthday cake or a nest of baby birds?

name: ntopp
text: Wait, wait. Envelope's in this one? Is he... hiding behind a horizon line?

name: connellingus
text: He's the guy standing with the anti-abortion protesters. After this strip , he apparently changed his hair color and tattoo to hide from the shame of losing a fight to Ray.

name: twotonturkey
text: say, wait a minute, I thought Beef wasn't much a Scotch guy.  He wasn't into the Aberlour.  Also, doing shots of Scotch is hella crass.

name: jhamiltonwa
text: And furthermore I think the distillery Ray was referring to is Cragganmore, not Craggamore

name: daniel_grieff
text: Am I bi-polar is I have the same opinions that I can project Beef and Ray having at different moments of my life?

name: daniel_grieff
text: (IF I have the same opinions..)

name: cbtbone
text:
Not at all. I actually found the last panel especially true to my own conflicting feelings on the subject. I think that, when it comes to large life decisions, we all have our inner Ray, indulgent, impulsive, all jumping into the ocean with no life jacket, as well as our inner Beef, shy, scared, all running from any challenge or gamble.

I guess what I am trying to say is that it is basically a thing.

name: rogergs
text: Doing shots of Scotch and mispronouncing the name of the distillery is hella Ray.

name: philipmarschall
text: Ray says Cragganmore in the strip?

name: hungoverdrawn
text:
Best Strip Ever.

You know, there's a million fine looking women in the world, dude. But they don't all bring you lasagna at work.

name: alisonface
text: Oh my god!! I thought that too when I read this.

name: alisonface
text:
God, Ray's "a dude walks down the street..." line makes me SO sad right now.

It's like Onstad is looking right into my life...

I think this strip is my new favorite.

name: plezure
text: I used to eat cheese sandwiches everyday for breakfast...

name: philipmarschall
text: I would like to see a GIN OCEAN strip, hopefully one with a large number of panels with Roast Beef stumbling around intoxicated and discussing marriage with his fellow partygoers. Perhaps Todd's opinions on marriage could be found in this strip; that would be capital.

name: keithcozz
text:
I have not posted before, as I am rather shy. However, the fact that a comic strip made me cry (and not from laughing, mind you) is fairly remarkable.

See panel eleven. Goddamn.

name: keithcozz
text:
Just read it again...Cried again.

There is a very good chance that I should stop drinking.

name: likeiwassaying
text:
never. you must never stop drinking.

the kind of drinking that makes one cry at truly sad things is the BEST kind of drinking.

name: raychurr
text: This world ain't nothin' but bad news and the pills that go with it. At what point did Ray go from being a jackass to one insightful motherfucker?

name: falseprophet
text: Dude come on man he was never really a jackass people tend to make that mistake about his A-type personality, I mean yeah sure sometimes he will do things to objects that are typical to your possession but that is only because in his heart he would always reciprocate proactively. He is cold "hey man" like that.

name: dasilodavi
text: It's like a long-form improv sketch that nobody wants to end!

name: brokeaccount
text: The little Christian fundamentalist looks like his hair is made out of wood.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs (Friday - Sunday)

Onstad: Bacon No. 3: Carlton Farms Canadian-Style Bacon

name: 21echoes
text:
the last two panels kill me every time

brilliant.

name: likeiwassaying
text: Ray's line in the next to last frame is the best line that has ever been said in Achewood. It amazes me constantly.

name: nickb285
text: I love this strip. It's so completely just two dudes talking about life.

name: ketelcat
text:
I just Love the dialogue in the last four panels. I can't think of how to express my liking for those panels another way.
They are like..the perfect things to say, ever.

name: arelladawn
text: This conversation in the last half of this strip is beautiful.  Just f***ing heartwarming.

name: tripleoptics
text: this world ain't nothing but bad news and the pills that go with it...

name: greenkoolayd
text: when youve had to earn or make everything you need(or want, even), the fact that someone remembers you on gift-giving holidays means so much more.  especially if said person has you in mind a full 9 months in advance and they have the similar, or less, pertaining to monetary comfort.

name: atypicaloracle
text: Ray is a simple creature, but he comes across with some power in this strip. This is just one of those strips that make it believable that Ray and Beef have been knuckleheads since small times - and that Ray is, his eccentric outlook on socially acceptable behavior aside, truly concerned for the well-being of his friend.
